content.question: A researcher claims that the epinephrine signaling pathway controls a catabolic process in muscle cells. Which of the following statements best helps justify the researcherâ€™s claim?

choices.label: Epinephrine is a signaling molecule that binds to a transmembrane protein.
The G protein in the epinephrine signaling pathway consists of three different subunits.
Phosphorylase kinase catalyzes the hydrolysis of <math alttext="A T P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>ATP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.
Glycogen phosphorylase catalyzes the conversion of glycogen to glucose-1-phosphate.

content.answer: Glycogen phosphorylase catalyzes the conversion of glycogen to glucose-1-phosphate.

skill.text: 6.C: Provide reasoning to justify a claim by connecting evidence to biological theories.
